intro: Malacothrix saxatilis var. tenuissima, commonly known as the slender rock moss, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant has delicate, thread-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or grayish hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. This variety is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in alpine or arctic regions.
